result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Otten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100.00 cash bond applied. Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Otten

records.addlTxt:
9:16 AM Defendant Andrew J Otten in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Andrew J Otten.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Sutton relates.
State moves to amend.
Count 1 amend to county ordinance, damage to property, 9.11-Court grants amendment.
No contest plea entered. 
Count finds guilty and orders $200.50 forfeiture plus amendment fee.

4:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew J Otten appeared by video.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Andrew J Otten. 

4:18  Court relates and gives appearances.
4:18  Atty. Sutton indicates defendant wishes to waive his right to preliminary hearing.
4:19  Court questions defendant; defendant indicates he wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing; Court questions Atty. Sutton.  Court accepts waiver.
Bound over.
Arraignment set; must appear in person.
Bond to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew J Otten appeared by video.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Andrew J Otten.
Defendant and Attorney Sutton put in a break out room. 10:39 Attorney Sutton requests preliminary hearing and waives time limits.  Defendant may appear by zoom for next date.  No changes to address or phone number.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Attorney fees.  Laura Sutton appointed.  Repay $75.00 per month starting 06/25/2022.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew J Otten

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: $75.00/month to begin 6/25/22 for Attorney Laura Sutton
Adjourned initial appearance on July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

10:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew J Otten in court. Attorney Laura Sutton appears by Zoom video.
Has not called the Public Defender's office to see if he qualifies.  Court questions Defendant and he likely does not qualify for Public Defender.  Blue form given to complete in court.  ***11:02 a.m. case recalled and Defendant sworn and signs blue form.  Court relates and appoints Attorney Laura Sutton to be repaid at $75.00 per month starting 06/25/22 by wage assignment and must stop at the Clerk's office after court.  Bond set.  Address confirmed and phone number updated.  AIA set and MAY APPEAR BY ZOOM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
